author: Omar Rashid
text:
Akhilesh forms special teams to nab culprits

In the latest incident of violence against scribes in Uttar Pradesh, three assailants shot dead a journalist in the Sultanpur district on Saturday.

Karun Misra, 32, was travelling in a car to his home district Ambedkarnagar when he was shot at by motorcycle-borne assailants. Mr. Misra, a journalist with Hindi daily Jan Sandesh , was rushed to the hospital but he succumbed to bullet wounds, a police spokesperson said.

Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav has ordered Director-General of Police Javeed Ahmed to form special teams to nab the culprits. Mr. Yadav, expressing “deep concern” over the incident, announced an ex gratia of Rs. 10 lakh for the family of the journalist, the CMO said.
title: Journalist shot dead in U.P.
